cpu/xmega/ccp.S

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00038 #include <assembler.h>
00039 #include <cpu/regs.h>
00040 
00041         /*
00042          * GNU and IAR use different calling conventions. Since this is
00043          * a very small and simple function to begin with, it's easier
00044          * to implement it twice than to deal with the differences
00045          * within a single implementation.
00046          *
00047          * Interrupts are disabled by hardware during the timed
00048          * sequence, so there's no need to save/restore interrupt state.
00049          */
00050 
00051         PUBLIC_FUNCTION(mmio_ccp_write8)
00052 
00053 #if defined(__GNUC__)
00054 
00055         ST_CPUREG(r1, RAMPZ)            // Reset bits 23:16 of Z
00056         movw    r30, r24                // Load addr into Z
00057         ldi     r18, CCP_IOREG          // Load magic CCP value
00058         ST_CPUREG(r18, CCP)             // Start CCP handshake
00059         st      Z, r22                  // Write value to I/O register
00060         ret                             // Return to caller
00061 
00062 #elif defined(__IAR_SYSTEMS_ASM__)
00063 
00064         ldi     r20, 0
00065         ST_CPUREG(r20, RAMPZ)           // Reset bits 23:16 of Z
00066 # if defined(CONFIG_MEMORY_MODEL_TINY)
00067         mov     r31, r20                // Reset bits 8:15 of Z
00068         mov     r30, r16                // Load addr into Z
00069 # else
00070         movw    r30, r16                // Load addr into Z
00071 # endif
00072         ldi     r21, CCP_IOREG          // Load magic CCP value
00073         ST_CPUREG(r21, CCP)             // Start CCP handshake
00074 # if defined(CONFIG_MEMORY_MODEL_TINY)
00075         st      Z, r17                  // Write value to I/O register
00076 # elif defined(CONFIG_MEMORY_MODEL_SMALL)
00077         st      Z, r18                  // Write value to I/O register
00078 # elif defined(CONFIG_MEMORY_MODEL_LARGE)
00079         st      Z, r19                  // Write value to I/O register
00080 # else
00081 #  error Unknown memory model in use, no idea how registers should be accessed
00082 # endif
00083         ret                             // Return to caller
00084 
00085 #else
00086 # error Unknown assembler
00087 #endif
00088 
00089         END_FUNC(mmio_ccp_write8)
00090         END_FILE()
